page.title: 17CRADLEY SINCE 1949
page.content: In 1949 Cradley was a rural village. Most of the people worked on farms. There was no electricity,no mains water or drainage.People used oil lamps and a man used to do a paraffin round once a week.The water came from a well and to get enough water up to a tank in the roof you had to do at least 1000 pumps a day.The sewage was collected in a cess pit in the garden Many hops were grown and in September lots of hop pickers used to come from all over in horse drawn wagons.The doctor had to make all his own medicines,and since the NHS in 1948 he was very busy.Aspirins were a great help in medical services. The roads were very dusty and every time a lorry went by,houses got covered in dust.The Bosbury road was very busy because lorries used to come through from Wales taking a short cut to Birmingham
